Submodules¶

model.BP module¶

Author:Dominic Hunt
class model.BP.BP(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: model.model.model

The Beysian predictor model

Parameters:

gamma : float, optional

Sensitivity parameter for probabilities

beta : float, optional

Decision threshold parameter

oneProb : array, optional

The prior probability

prior : array of two floats in [0,1] or just float in range, optional

The prior probability of of the two states being the correct one. Default array([0.5,0.5])

stimFunc : function, optional

The function that transforms the stimulus into a form the model can understand and a string to identify it later. Default is blankStim

decFunc : function, optional

The function that takes the internal values of the model and turns them in to a decision. Default is model.decision.binary.decBeta

Attributes

Name (string) The name of the class used when recording what has been used.
Name = 'BP'¶
action()[source]¶
Returns:action : integer or None
outputEvolution()[source]¶

Returns all the relevent data for this model

Returns:

results : dict

The dictionary contains a series of keys including Name, Probabilities, Actions and Events.
storeState()[source]¶

Stores the state of all the important variables so that they can be accessed later

model.BP.blankStim()[source]¶

Default stimulus processor. Does nothing.Returns [1,0]

Returns:

blankStimFunc : function

The function expects to be passed the event and then return [1,0].

currAction : int

The current action chosen by the model. Used to pass participant action to model when fitting

Attributes

Name (string) The identifier of the function

Parameters:

Learning rate parameter

Sensitivity parameter for probabilities

Decision threshold parameter

The activity of the neurons. The values are between [0,1]

The prior probability of of the two states being the correct one. Default array([0.5,0.5])

The function that transforms the stimulus into a form the model can understand and a string to identify it later. Default is blankStim

model.MS module¶

Author:Dominic Hunt
Reference:Jumping to conclusions: a network model predicts schizophrenic patients’ performance on a probabilistic reasoning task. Moore, S. C., & Sellen, J. L. (2006). Cognitive, Affective & Behavioral Neuroscience, 6(4), 261–9. Retrieved from http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17458441
class model.MS.MS(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: model.model.model

The Moore & Sellen model

Parameters:

alpha : float, optional

Learning rate parameter

gamma : float, optional

Sensitivity parameter for probabilities

beta : float, optional

Decision threshold parameter

oneProb : float in [0,1], optional

The probability of a 1 from the first jar. This is also the probability of a 0 from the second jar.

prior : array of two floats in [0,1] or just float in range, optional

The prior probability of of the two states being the correct one. Default array([0.5,0.5])

activity : array, optional

The activity of the neurons. The values are between [0,1]

stimFunc : function, optional

The function that transforms the stimulus into a form the model can understand and a string to identify it later. Default is blankStim

decFunc : function, optional

The function that takes the internal values of the model and turns them in to a decision. Default is model.decision.binary.decBeta

Attributes

Name (string) The name of the class used when recording what has been used.
currAction (int) The current action chosen by the model. Used to pass participant action to model when fitting
Name = 'M&S'¶
action()[source]¶
Returns:action : integer or None

model.RVPM module¶

Author:Dominic Hunt
Reference:Value and prediction error in medial frontal cortex: integrating the single-unit and systems levels of analysis. Silvetti, M., Seurinck, R., & Verguts, T. (2011). Frontiers in Human Neuroscience, 5(August), 75. doi:10.3389/fnhum.2011.00075
class model.RVPM.RVPM(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: model.model.model

The reward value and prediction model

Parameters:

alpha : float, optional

Learning rate parameter for updating the cue-value weights. Default 0.3

gamma : float, optional

It is a time constant that controls how quickly the neural units (modeled as dynamical systems) respond to external inputs. Default 0.1

zeta : float, optional

Regulates the ratio between the power (amplitude) of expectation relative to delta units. Default 2

w : array, optional

The stimulus weights. Default [0.01,0.01]

tau : float, optional

The timing signal mean. Default 160

z : float, optional

The timing signal spread. Default 20

averaging : int, optional

The number of stimuli recorded from the beginning and end of each training set. Default is 3

stimFunc : function, optional

The function that transforms the stimulus into a form the model can understand and a string to identify it later. Default is blankStim

decFunc : function, optional

The function that takes the internal values of the model and turns them in to a decision. Default is basicDecision

Attributes

Name (string) The name of the class used when recording what has been used.
currAction (int) The current action chosen by the model. Used to pass participant action to model when fitting
Name = 'RVPM'¶
action()[source]¶
Returns:action : integer or None

The default decision function for RVPM

Returns:

beadStim : function

The function expects to be passed the probabilities and then return None.

Attributes

Name (string) The identifier of the function
model.RVPM.blankStim()[source]¶

The default stimulus processor generator for RVPM

Passes the pavlov stimuli to models that cope with stimuli and rewards that have a duration.

Returns:

blankStimFunc : function

The function yields a series of ten events t,0,0`, where t is the time. The stimulus and reward are set to 0.

model.model module¶

Author:Dominic Hunt
class model.model.model(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

The model class is a general template for a model. It also contains universal methods used by all models.

Attributes

Name (string) The name of the class used when recording what has been used.
currAction (int) The current action chosen by the model. Used to pass participant action to model when fitting
Name = 'model'¶
action()[source]¶

Returns the action of the model

Returns:action : integer or None
feedback(response)[source]¶

Receives the reaction to the action

Parameters:

response : float

The stimulus from the experiment. Returns without doing anything if the value of response is None.

Abstract class for the creation of plots relevant to a model

The data produced by the model

The parameters associated with the model

A unique identifier for the model

Returns the plots

Returns:

figure : matplotlib.pyplot.figure
Raises:

StopIteration

When there are no more figures to return

model.modelSetPlot module¶

Author:Dominic Hunt
class model.modelSetPlot.modelSetPlot(modelSet, modelParams, modelLabels)[source]¶

Bases: object

Abstract class for the creation of plots for sets of results from a model

Parameters:

modelSet : list of dictionaries

A list of sets of data produced by each model

modelParams : list with dictionaries

List of parameters associated with each model

modelLabels : list with strings

A list of unique identifiers for each model

Returns the plots

figure : matplotlib.pyplot.figure
Raises:

StopIteration

When there are no more figures to return

class model.qLearn.qLearn(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: model.model.model

The q-Learning algorithm

Parameters:

alpha : float, optional

Learning rate parameter

gamma : float, optional

Sensitivity parameter for probabilities

beta : float, optional

Decision threshold parameter

prior : array of two floats in [0,1] or just float in range, optional

The prior probability of of the two states being the correct one. Default array([0.5,0.5])

expect: float, optional

The initialisation of the the expected reward

stimFunc : function, optional

The function that transforms the stimulus into a form the model can understand and a string to identify it later. Default is blankStim

decFunc : function, optional

The function that takes the internal values of the model and turns them in to a decision. Default is model.decision.binary.decBeta

Attributes

Name (string) The name of the class used when recording what has been used.
currAction (int) The current action chosen by the model. Used to pass participant action to model when fitting

model.qLearn2 module¶

Author:Dominic Hunt
Reference:Modified version of that found in the paper The role of the ventromedial prefrontal cortex in abstract state-based inference during decision making in humans. Hampton, A. N., Bossaerts, P., & O’Doherty, J. P. (2006). The Journal of Neuroscience : The Official Journal of the Society for Neuroscience, 26(32), 8360–7. doi:10.1523/JNEUROSCI.1010-06.2006

class model.qLearn2.qLearn2(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: model.model.model

The q-Learning algorithm

Parameters:

alpha : float, optional

Learning rate parameter

gamma : float, optional

Sensitivity parameter for probabilities

beta : float, optional

Decision threshold parameter

nu : float in range [0,0.5], optional

The idecision point between the two choices. Default is 0

prior : array of two floats in [0,1] or just float in range, optional

The prior probability of of the two states being the correct one. Default array([0.5,0.5])

expect: float, optional

The initialisation of the the expected reward

stimFunc : function, optional

The function that transforms the stimulus into a form the model can understand and a string to identify it later. Default is blankStim

decFunc : function, optional

The function that takes the internal values of the model and turns them in to a decision. Default is model.decision.binary.decBeta

See also

model.qLearn
This model is heavily based on that one

Attributes

Name (string) The name of the class used when recording what has been used.
currAction (int) The current action chosen by the model. Used to pass participant action to model when fitting

class model.qLearn2a.qLearn2a(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: model.model.model

The q-Learning algorithm modified to have different positive and negative reward prediction errors

Parameters:

alpha : float, optional

Learning rate parameter. For this model only used when setting alphaPos and alphaNeg to the same value. Default 0.3

alphaPos : float, optional

The positive learning rate parameter. Used when RPE is positive. Default is alpha

alphaNeg : float, optional

The negative learning rate parameter. Used when RPE is negative. Default is alpha

gamma : float, optional

Sensitivity parameter for probabilities

beta : float, optional

Decision threshold parameter

nu : float in range [0,0.5], optional

The idecision point between the two choices. Default is 0

prior : array of two floats in [0,1] or just float in range, optional

The prior probability of of the two states being the correct one. Default array([0.5,0.5])

expect: float, optional

The initialisation of the the expected reward

stimFunc : function, optional

The function that transforms the stimulus into a form the model can understand and a string to identify it later. Default is blankStim

decFunc : function, optional

The function that takes the internal values of the model and turns them in to a decision. Default is model.decision.binary.decBeta

See also

model.qLearn2
This model is heavily based on that one

Attributes

Name (string) The name of the class used when recording what has been used.
currAction (int) The current action chosen by the model. Used to pass participant action to model when fitting
Name = 'qLearn2a'¶
